name: National Treasury — State Corporations Division
notes: Primary government shareholder representative. Oversees dividend policy, financial performance reporting, and government guarantee approvals for all three SOEs.

engagements.summary: Annual dividend review meeting — KPA FY2023 dividend confirmed at KES 4.1bn.
FY2023 Q4 financial reports submitted to National Treasury.

name: State Department for Energy
notes: Line ministry for KPLC. Approves strategic plans, performance contracts, and tariff review positions. Government representative on KPLC board.

engagements.summary: FY2024/25 KPLC Performance Contract signed.
Directive on LMCP Phase IV targets and timeline issued to KPLC.

name: State Department for Transport
notes: Line ministry for Kenya Airways and Kenya Ports Authority. Approves strategic plans, port tariffs, and route licensing. Government representative on KQ and KPA boards.

engagements.summary: KPA Performance Contract FY2024/25 signed — throughput target 1.5m TEUs.
KQ Restructuring Plan progress review — H2 2023 performance assessed.

name: Energy and Petroleum Regulatory Authority (EPRA)
notes: Statutory regulator for electricity sector. Sets tariffs, licenses power utilities, monitors KPLC compliance with technical standards (SAIDI/SAIFI), and investigates service interruptions.

engagements.summary: EPRA issued request for additional information on KPLC tariff review submission.
EPRA annual compliance inspection of KPLC distribution system.

name: Kenya Civil Aviation Authority (KCAA)
notes: Aviation regulator responsible for issuing and overseeing Kenya Airways' Air Operating Certificate, pilot licensing, and airworthiness compliance. ICAO standards enforcer.

engagements.summary: KQ Air Operating Certificate renewed for 2024-2026 period.
KCAA Line Station inspection at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport — findings cleared.

name: Kenya Airports Authority (KAA)
notes: KAA manages JKIA and Wilson Airport — critical infrastructure for Kenya Airways operations. Landing fee negotiations and slot allocation are key engagement areas.

engagements.summary: KQ and KAA agreed revised landing fee schedule for 2024 with 5% increase.
JKIA Terminal 1C extension planning — KQ capacity requirements submitted to KAA.

name: Kenya Electricity Generating Company (KenGen)
notes: KenGen is KPLC's largest power supplier, providing approximately 70% of electricity from geothermal, hydro, and thermal plants. Power Purchase Agreement terms directly impact KPLC's cost structure.

engagements.summary: PPA renegotiation completed — 5-year PPA with 3% annual escalation agreed.

name: Kenya Electrical Trades and Allied Workers Union (KETAWU)
notes: KETAWU represents approximately 6,500 KPLC unionisable employees. CBA negotiations occur every 3 years. Key issues include pay, safety conditions, and contractors encroaching on unionisable work.

engagements.summary: 2024-2026 CBA negotiations commenced. Union is demanding 18% wage increase.
2022-2024 CBA signed — 12% wage increase over 2 years.

name: Kenya Aviation Workers Union (KAWU)
notes: KAWU represents Kenya Airways non-management staff including cabin crew, ground handlers, and administrative staff. Sensitive to restructuring and redundancy proposals.

engagements.summary: 2023-2025 CBA annual review — Mid-term pay adjustment of 5% agreed.
KAWU 2023-2025 CBA signed — 10% increase in Year 1, 7% in Year 2.

name: Kenya Airline Pilots Association (KALPA)
notes: KALPA represents Kenya Airways pilots. Pilot costs are a major component of KQ's cost structure. Pilot contract renegotiations are high-stakes given shortage of qualified KQ-type-rated pilots.

engagements.summary: KALPA raised concerns about pilot rostering practices and minimum rest periods.

name: Dock Workers Union of Kenya (DOWU)
notes: DOWU represents KPA dock workers. Work-to-rule actions can significantly impact port throughput. The 2023 CBA provides for 14% wage increase and improved safety facilities.

engagements.summary: 2023-2025 CBA signed with 14% wage increase over 2 years and improved PPE provision.

name: World Bank — Kenya Energy Program
position: Task Team Leader, Kenya Energy Program
notes: World Bank funds the Last Mile Connectivity Project (LMCP) with USD 150m under IDA Credit. Quarterly disbursement reviews and results monitoring are key engagement activities.

engagements.summary: World Bank LMCP Phase III supervision mission — satisfactory progress rating given.
Phase III USD 150m disbursement approved.

name: International Monetary Fund (IMF)
notes: IMF monitors Kenya's fiscal position including SOE contingent liabilities. KQ's debt obligations and government guarantees are flagged in Article IV consultations. Kenya Airways restructuring is closely watched.

engagements.summary: IMF Article IV mission — KQ contingent liabilities of KES 95bn flagged as fiscal risk.

name: African Development Bank (AfDB)
notes: AfDB co-finances KPLC's rural electrification and transmission expansion. KPA's Berths 21-24 were partly financed through AfDB sovereign loan of USD 200m.

engagements.summary: AfDB KPA loan review — disbursement tracker updated, final tranche approved.

name: Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission (EACC)
notes: EACC oversees corruption risk management in all state corporations. Annual integrity reports required. KPLC procurement processes are periodically investigated.

engagements.summary: EACC facilitated integrity and anti-corruption training for KPLC senior management (120 staff).

name: Office of the Auditor General
notes: The Auditor General audits KPA and KPLC as state corporations. Annual audit reports tabled in Parliament. Adverse opinions can trigger Parliamentary committee inquiries.

engagements.summary: OAG audit of KPA FY2023 — clean opinion issued.
OAG audit of KPLC FY2023 — unqualified opinion with emphasis of matter on related party transactions.

name: Nairobi Securities Exchange (NSE)
notes: KPLC and Kenya Airways are listed on the NSE. Continuous disclosure obligations, results announcements, and corporate actions require NSE notifications.

engagements.summary: KPLC FY2023 results and dividend announcement filed with NSE.
KQ FY2023 results filed with NSE — going concern note reiterated.

name: Capital Markets Authority (CMA)
notes: CMA regulates listed companies KPLC and KQ in relation to capital market obligations, insider trading rules, and prospectus requirements for capital raises.

engagements.summary: CMA corporate governance review of KPLC — findings addressed within required timelines.

name: Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA)
notes: KRA collects corporate tax, VAT, and PAYE from all three SOEs. Transfer pricing reviews and customs (for KQ parts imports) are key engagement areas. Disputed tax assessments require careful management.

engagements.summary: KRA tax audit of KPA for 2021-2023 tax years — additional KES 420m assessment issued. Under appeal.

name: Kenya Ports Authority Users Association (KPAUA)
notes: KPAUA represents shipping lines, freight forwarders, and cargo owners using Mombasa Port. Tariff increases and port efficiency are major concerns. Regular consultations required.

engagements.summary: KPA consulted KPAUA on proposed 8% tariff increase for FY2025 — conditional support given.

name: Parliamentary Committee on Energy
notes: Parliamentary Energy Committee oversees KPLC performance and tariff policies. KPLC senior management appear before the committee annually. Power outages trigger emergency summons.

engagements.summary: KPLC CEO appeared before Energy Committee to explain Nairobi CBD blackout of 3 October 2024.

name: SkyTeam Alliance
notes: Kenya Airways is a SkyTeam member. Codeshare and interline agreements with Air France-KLM, Delta, and other members generate significant connectivity and revenue. Alliance fees and obligations apply.

engagements.summary: SkyTeam annual member CEO meeting — KQ reaffirmed commitment and expanded codeshare with KLM.

name: International Air Transport Association (IATA)
notes: IATA provides safety, operational standards, and BSP (billing and settlement plan) clearing services for KQ. IATA Operational Safety Audit (IOSA) registration is critical for KQ's code-share partnerships.

engagements.summary: IATA IOSA audit renewal — Kenya Airways retained IOSA registration for 2024-2026.

name: National Environment Management Authority (NEMA)
notes: NEMA approves Environmental Impact Assessments for KPLC transmission projects and KPA port expansion works. Environmental licence compliance is regularly audited.

engagements.summary: NEMA approved EIA for KPA Berths 25-26 with 12 conditions.
NEMA compliance audit of KPLC transmission lines — minor non-conformance on vegetation management.

name: Mombasa County Government
notes: Mombasa County Government is a key stakeholder for KPA given the port's central role in the county economy. County approvals for port expansion works and community engagement are essential.

engagements.summary: KPA MD met Governor on Berths 25-26 construction — community CSR commitments agreed.
